Building an accessible accordion with HTML and CSS

Play Video: Building an accessible accordion with HTML and CSS
  • 11 June 2025
  • learn

Show Notes:

Part one

Accordions with JS

Borrowed from Sara Soueidan’s excellent Practical Accessibility course:

  • Typical approach using HTML buttons.
  • Accordion with "interactive headings" (progressive enhancement).
  • In-page search issues may be solved with the new hidden=until-found attribute.

Disclosure widget

  • With details the browser has a built-in shadow DOM component.
  • details-content has browser styles set to content-visibility: hidden which changes to block.
  • Styling the marker is limited.

See disclosure widget code

Exclusive CSS accordion

  • We can use 'open" to keep any panel open.<details open>
  • With a matching name attribute we get an exclusive accordion. <details name="anyname">
  • We can fix the height and allow scroll (Adrian Roselli’s example).
  • In our example I have borrowed the mock icon from web.dev..
  • In page search works.

See accordion code
